pros: Very good work/life balance very good benefits

pros: Small collegial environment and nice balance

job_title: Interactive Communications Specialist in Memphis, TN
pros: Flexible, good benefits, great community

pros: Chill environment and not much workload
cons: Pay is bad, with minimal raise

pros: Interesting liberal ideas advocated by some (not the hip ones) Professors to aid students in their academic careers, professional careers, and otherwise. Sadly, these Professors often do not get what they deserve and can be denied tenure.
cons: Rudeness is a huge problem, especially among the faculty. I suspect some of these faculty are oversexed and attend too many Greek parties. There is a huge problem with the assigning of grades at Rhodes College. Because the faculty is so cowardly, they often misassign grades to the popular students and ignore the quality of work done by the students overall. Any formal acknowledgement of academics at Rhodes is a chore involving these colossal mistakes.

review_title: Great place to work with low salary and benefits
pros: Great students and great co-workers
cons: The benefits are less than ideal. Retirement contributions but the school are very low.

review_title: Good College to start your career
pros: Easy to find opportunities within the college
cons: Recognition outside of Memphis is lower

pros: Work-life balance. Friendly colleagues. Beautiful campus. Gated Community
cons: New major software transition, Workday.

pros: It is a Beautiful campus.
cons: It is an extremely conservative environment,

pros: good people, good supervisors, great place
cons: Pay is lower than other places doing the same thing

review_title: The highs are high and the lows are the salary.
pros: Good place to work with supportive peers.
cons: Salary is not great considering how many roles everyone has to take on.

job_title: Business Systems Analyst in Memphis, TN
pros: Beautiful campus. The people are great.
cons: Outdated processed. Unorganized leadership. Siloed systems.

pros: It's Great place to work
cons: Don't have any! I love Rhodes

pros: Easy way to make money as a college student without actually having to work.
cons: Can get in the way of your party schedule

review_title: Rhodes offers great job opportunities to college students
job_title: Digital Communications Associate in Memphis, TN
pros: It is great to have a manageable part-time job while attending college full-time. Not a heavy workload, great team/boss, fun position working a lot with photo editing and organization.
cons: wasn't challenged by the work I was doing.

pros: Good people and a great place to work.
cons: Low wages and a large gap between high and low.

pros: Decent place to work as staff/faculty.
cons: They don't pay that well.

pros: Great students and great administrators
cons: Pay below industry and benefits are lacking

job_title: Digital Communications Assistant in Memphis, TN
pros: Amazing team and really flexible around your student schedule. Great way to network and get started in an office environment.
cons: There is some down time in the office, but there is always some kind of task you can work on.

pros: Good retirement benefits and a great culture
cons: No maternity leave and little room for advancement

pros: stimulating unique lush collegial enjoyable

pros: Very supportive environment and friendly culture.
cons: Higher education salaries are low, but they generally have good benefits.

pros: Great students, colleagues, and location. Memphis is a real gem.

job_title: Assistant Softball Coach in Memphis, TN
pros: supportive staff, beautiful campus, great students
cons: lack of organization, no concrete schedule

pros: Great colleagues and students. Generous benefits
cons: Students sometimes over extend themselves

pros: The campus is beautiful! Overall the students, faculty, staff and administrators are motivated and create an atmosphere for change. The honor code makes it even more interesting with a strong community feel.
cons: The school administrators and some students focus too much on the "Rhodes lifestyle" and the donor base, often resulting in a lack of advancement and diversity on campus. Privileged is a huge issue that continues to cause issues between student groups and the greater community. Structurally, the small size of the campus makes it hard for advancement.

job_title: Bike Shop Manager in Memphis, TN
pros: The opportunities to gain leadership skills and take hope good pay as an RSAP are surprisingly abundant and varied.  Rhodes does a good job of matching students to jobs that actually reflect their skills and interests, not just opportunities for pay.
cons: Because student workers report to the department for which they work 99.9%, it can be hard to deal with central administration who often don't fully understand exactly what you do or why.  Each department manages its workers in different ways, and the differences between academic departments, physical plant, the library, etc. can be immense.

pros: Flexible hours, excellent environment,, friendly people. I enjoy getting to meet new people and learning about the college while I am a student here
cons: None that I can think of. Everything about the job is ideal for someone in college. Flexible hours is very helpful. I wish it paid more but don't we all?

pros: Learned about quality service, good office/phone etiquette, college related processes in regards to infastructure (day to day operations), and web development
cons: Sometimes busy work wasn't very fun, but I guess that comes with the territory.

pros: Easy work hours, often times not very busy, they let you work on other things while there aren't many people needing tutoring
cons: Lack of student and teacher coordination

pros: During my time at Rhodes, the Urban Studies Dept. chair was excellent with regard to appropriately scheduling student employees and offering any assistance our group required to perform our job well.
cons: Occasionally, projects overwhelmed the department's abilities.

job_title: Assistant Director, Career Services in Memphis, TN
pros: There are lots of resources and lots of good people. The students are motivated and fun to work with, plus the grounds are beautiful!
cons: I have been very satisfied with this position.

pros:
-Allows student employees to work around their school schedule
-Provides employees with opportunity to acquire transferable skills
-Staff, faculty, and students make it an easy working environment
cons: School and work breaks do not coincide

pros: So inclusive, forward thinking with lots of training and opportunities to get involved on campus
cons: Sometimes the schedule to get put on rounds duty was unfair

pros: Very team oriented environment, good leadership, meaningful work
cons: There are sometimes so many good initiatives going on that it is difficult to keep up with the work

review_title: ok for a new professional, not realistic for anyone who wants a family
